about_me.title: About Me
about_me.intro: A glimpse into my journey, between code and passions

bio.title: Background and Education
bio.text:
My journey into the world of development began at the age of 15 when HTML4 and CSS2 dominated the digital scene. I took my first steps by creating components for portals on ForumFree, ForumCommunity, and occasionally even on MySpace. 
 In 2020, I made a significant decision: to enroll in the Boolean Careers course, promising to train Full Stack Web Developers from scratch.

Since then, my passion for coding has transformed into a structured training path. During the course, I gained in-depth skills and later chose to specialize in the frontend, completing additional courses, including two focused on SEO. Since 2021, I've had the opportunity to work in teams on Angular projects, which I consider my forte to date.

This ongoing growth journey is fueled by curiosity and the desire to learn more in the vast universe of web development. I am continuing to take dedicated courses. The creation of this portfolio also stems from my desire to put into practice what I have learned over the years. The transition from team to individual work has allowed me to delve into parts of Angular usually handled by other colleagues.

bio.title: Work Philosophy
bio.text:
In my approach to work, I am always looking for new insights and solutions in the world of web development. I enjoy exploring different perspectives and seeking the opinions of colleagues and friends. Recently, I found in ChatGPT an excellent study companion, capable of advising me on how to approach different situations and at the same time creating exercises to improve my skills.

Throughout my journey, I adopted a simple statement from one of my Boolean instructors on the first day, 'Always keep learning.' Just two words, but I immediately marked them in my notebook and still carry them with me, a constant reminder to keep the desire to learn and grow professionally alive.

bio.title: Future Goals
bio.text:
In 2021, I started a course on React, but due to some work dynamics, I had to interrupt it, although I would like to resume it and use it for a couple of personal projects, considering it a technology of great relevance in the world of web development. I am sure it would be a significant addition to my skills.

Additionally, I would like to delve into the field of UX/UI; user experience and interface design are crucial elements for the success of any project, and I believe that investing time in this area can significantly contribute to my professional growth, as frontend developers work closely with web designers.

bio.title: Hobbies
bio.text:
Outside the coding world, I find refuge in reading, exploring genres like fantasy, science fiction, historical, and mystery, and lately, I have pleasantly rediscovered gamebooks.
I love board games, practice Renaissance fencing, sport fishing, trekking, and archery.
And, of course, my cats cannot be missedâ€”more than precious companions in the time I spend at home, also diligent supervisors of practically any domestic affair, when they're not trying to eat my mouse cable.

details.title: Behind the scenes
details.intro: The backstage of my portfolio: curiosities and development choices

timeline.title: My portfolio: powered by Angular
timeline.text: The choice to develop this portfolio with Angular aims to highlight my skills as a developer. Angular provides a robust and scalable environment, allowing me to fully showcase my abilities in creating advanced and dynamic web projects.

timeline.title: Development arsenal
timeline.text:
This portfolio was created using HTML5 for a solid structure, CSS3 for polished style and advanced style sheet management, while TypeScript was employed to ensure code reliability and robustness. 
 This is just an introduction to the technologies used, with more details on the libraries and tools utilized to follow.

timeline.title: Layout and navigation
timeline.text:
The layout ensures an intuitive experience, with a minimalist homepage featuring 5 hexagonal buttons as gateways to sections. 
 Each page follows a consistent pattern: header with name and options, central body with specific details, and footer for effortless navigation between sections.

timeline.title: Consistent structure for easy exploration
timeline.text: I opted for a unique but uniform structure, making navigation smooth, with a layout aimed at ensuring a cohesive experience, allowing users to explore the project easily and in a structured manner.

timeline.title: Responsive design: seamless experience on every screen
timeline.text: With a 'mobile-first' approach, responsive design ensures an optimal experience on every device: custom mixins and careful consideration of user experience allow my project to naturally adapt to various viewports, ensuring intuitive exploration on any device.

timeline.title: Accessibility and scalability: the REM choice
timeline.text: In my approach to web design, I choose to use REMs to define text sizes. This choice not only optimizes accessibility, making the experience easier for all users but also ensures natural scalability across different platforms. By opting for REMs, I aim to create a design suitable for every screen size and the needs of visually impaired users.

timeline.title: No Material fluttering or silly Bootstrap Classes in My Portfolio
timeline.text:
From the start, I chose a different path for this project. I prefer to avoid the extensive use of prepackaged frameworks, finding their classes often invasive. 
The freedom to design a unique style is essential, and I believe Material and Bootstrap are more suitable when the site's graphics are designed to adapt to their default style, not fitting for a customized project.

timeline.title: Optimized and stylish
timeline.text:
Defining custom styles and optimizing style sheets is essential. 
 Centralized SCSS files in styles.scss ensure efficiency and consistency, simplifying maintenance. 
 New components benefit from existing styles, reducing development time. 
 Optimization is crucial for a consistent and professional style, demonstrating the connection between practicality and elegance in web development.

timeline.title: GitHub: transparency and security
timeline.text:
Organized commits and dedicated branches reflect the phases and features implemented. 
 This practice facilitates code control, demonstrating commitment and transparency in project management. 
 Exploring my GitHub repository adds understanding and trust in the development process.

timeline.title: Advanced branch management for maximum efficiency
timeline.text:
Development with two main branches: master for stable deployment and stage for active development. 
 Stage is linked to an online environment for pre-deployment verification. 
 By keeping master stable, I ensure not to publish unwanted changes. 
 When stage is secure, I merge it into master to release new features also on the production site.

timeline.title: Email management without backend: EmailJS
timeline.text:
The form on the Contact Me page uses the EmailJS library to simplify email sending without having to work on the backend as well. 
 A convenient solution that frees up time to focus on the rest of the project.

timeline.title: International Portfolio: The Multilingual Experience
timeline.text:
In order to welcome an international audience, I introduced multilingual management in my portfolio using ngx-translate. 
 This library facilitates a smooth language transition, allowing easy translation of content both in Italian and English. 
 This choice aims to enhance the accessibility of my project, ensuring an inclusive and global user experience.

timeline.title: Between light and dark: your choice, your style
timeline.text:
Discover visual flexibility in my online space. With a custom design, activate the light theme by clicking on the sun or switch to the dark theme by clicking on the moon. 
 A feature developed to adapt to your preferences and offer you a comfortable visual environment during navigation.

timeline.title: Only LocalStorage
timeline.text:
My choice to preserve privacy: zero cookies, only local storage. 
 I use this technique to save only user preferences, such as the choice between light or dark theme and the selected language. 
 An approach to privacy respect, ensuring a personalized experience without compromising security.

timeline.title: This Portfolio is just the beginning!
timeline.text: All of this is just a taste of my skills. There are still numerous projects to explore and implementations to be made to make this portfolio even richer and more dynamic.
